title: NFL free agency tiers: Barnwell ranks the best QBs, RBs, WRs, TEs and OL
content: NFL free agency is almost here, and we placed players on offense into tiers based on their potential offseason contracts. Who could get paid?

title: Draft intel: Who is the best player in the class? Could Vegas trade out of No. 1?
content: We asked NFL execs, scouts and players to weigh in on the Raiders' No. 1 pick and the best prospects in 2026.

title: Vonn says surgery saved her from leg amputation
content: American skier Lindsey Vonn says she nearly lost her left leg following a frightening crash in the women's downhill at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Prestianni banned over alleged Vini racist abuse
content: UEFA has provisionally suspended Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni for Wednesday's Champions League match against Real Madrid following the incident with Vinicius Junior in last week's first leg.

title: Sources: Suns to be without Brooks for 4-6 weeks
content: The Suns will be without Dillon Brooks for four to six weeks, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania, as the guard recovers from a broken left hand.

title: Kara Braxton, 2-time WNBA champion, dies at 43
content: Kara Braxton, a two-time WNBA champion with the Detroit Shock and former SEC Freshman of the Year at Georgia, has died at the age of 43.

title: Games in Mexico called off after cartel boss killed
content: Four high-level soccer matches were postponed Sunday after the Mexican army killed the leader of a powerful drug cartel in a town close to the World Cup host city of Guadalajara.

title: Roddick joins ESPN for coverage of Grand Slams
content: Andy Roddick is joining ESPN for its coverage of Wimbledon and the US Open under a multiyear deal announced Monday.

title: LeBron stumps for C's Brown in MVP conversation
content: After Jaylen Brown fueled the Celtics' win over the Lakers on Sunday, he received an MVP endorsement from the other side of the storied rivalry.

title: 'The time is now': Inside the Darryn Peterson availability saga at Kansas
content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough time to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

title: Who makes Team USA in men's hockey at the 2030 Olympics?
content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

title: As NIL cash grows, coaches call for rules to protect athletes from 'street agents'
content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

title: Bubble Watch: Welcome to the 'locks,' Wisconsin
content: Wisconsin cemented its status as a 'lock' Sunday, though the SEC continues to lead the Big Ten in projected bids.

title: Bracketology watch guide: Houston's 1-seed chances, more key Monday games
content: How the bracket shifted after the weekend, plus key matchups for Houston, Kansas, Louisville, UNC tonight.

title: 'It's going to be a huge focus': Teams are dialing in on pitch tipping in 2026
content: With a new rule already in place, MLB front offices are cracking down on another tiny way to get an advantage.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: Arsenal back on track after big derby win; Real Madrid suffer shock LaLiga loss; more
content: Arsenal didn't panic ahead of Sunday's north London derby, and it paid off. Plus: Man City keep the pressure on, and Real Madrid suffer a shock to fall behind again in LaLiga.

title: Hair we go again: Why Man United fan's viral challenge might not end any time soon
content: Viral Manchester United fan Frank Ilett is not cutting his hair until the club wins five games in a row.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Sporting CP defender, Ben White future uncertain
content: Ben White could leave Arsenal this summer, while Luka Modric is reportedly open to returning home to Croatia. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'Ghost GDP': How AI boom could upend middle-class workers, global finance
content: In 2026, the global economic narrative has shifted from the initial excitement of AI to a more calculated and sometimes cautious phase. Citrini Research highlights a move away from the basic hardware race toward "Phase 2" of the AI trade, where the focus lies on operational efficiency and the displacement of high-cost human labor.  While corporate margins are expanding through automation and lean structures, there is a growing concern over "Ghost GDP".

title: 'Can do terrible things': Trump warns countries against 'playing games' after tariff ruling
content: President Trump launched a scathing attack on the Supreme Court, labeling it "incompetent" and "ridiculous" after it struck down his tariffs. He claimed the ruling inadvertently granted him broader presidential powers, particularly in trade policy through licensing tools, while criticizing the court's decision-making.

title: Canadian Billionaire Kevin O'Leary just told everyone how AI is not just about painful layoffs
content: Kevin O'Leary highlights AI's significant opportunities in content and marketing, noting a shift in advertising spend. He asserts that AI is creating new wealth and high-paying roles for creatives, contrasting with past job prospects. However, he also warns of a critical U.S. power shortage hindering AI's continued growth.

title: Times of India Gadgets Now Awards 2025: Top tech honoured at star-studded event
content: The Times of India Gadgets Now Awards 2025 celebrated India's top tech innovations, honoring excellence across smartphones, wearables, audio, and home entertainment. Samsung dominated the flagship and premium smartphone categories, securing the coveted Best Smartphone of the Year award for the Galaxy S25 Ultra.

title: 'US president is man of action. Wait and see': Iranians get ominous text as tensions escalate
content: Iran has received anonymous texts hinting at US action, amid escalating tensions with President Trump.  The US has bolstered its military presence in the Middle East, considering strikes even as diplomatic talks loom.  Meanwhile, renewed anti-government protests are sweeping across Iran, amplifying fears of a potential conflict.

title: Did Yunus try to 'destabilise' Dhaka? B'desh prez exposes big 'conspiracy', secret foreign trips
content: Bangladesh President Mohammed Shahabuddin accused former chief adviser Muhammad Yunus of constitutional breaches and attempts to destabilize the country and presidency. Shahabuddin stated Yunus failed to brief him on foreign visits and alleged a conspiracy to unconstitutionally replace him. The president also described his office being deliberately isolated and handicapped during the interim government period.

title: West Indies smash second-highest T20 World Cup total; check full list
content: West Indies delivered a historic batting performance, posting the second-highest T20 World Cup total of 254/6 against Zimbabwe. Shimron Hetmyer's blistering 85 off 34 balls, the fastest T20 World Cup fifty by a West Indian, set the stage for the monumental score.

title: Record shattered! Shimron Hetmyer breaks Chris Gayle's 17-year-old milestone
content: Shimron Hetmyer smashed a blistering 19-ball half-century at the Wankhede Stadium, setting a new West Indies record in T20 World Cup history. This remarkable feat surpassed Chris Gayle's previous record of 23 balls. Hetmyer's aggressive innings showcased the Caribbean team's fearless approach to the game.

title: What US SC tariff blow for Trump means for future of India's trade deal
content: India is expected to push for clauses that protect against similar judicial setbacks in the future. One source noted that the decision has materially weakened Trump’s negotiating leverage.

title: FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: What are they, how they work & how to detect one
content: ATM jackpotting malware is on the rise, with cybercriminals exploiting physical and software flaws to dispense cash without legitimate transactions.  The FBI warns of significant losses, highlighting how malware like Ploutus bypasses bank authorization by directly controlling ATM hardware.  Physical indicators like open doors and unauthorized devices signal potential compromise, urging immediate action.

title: Arihant, Arighaat, Aridhaman: Inside India's invisible & deadly undersea arsenal
content: India's underwater defense is advancing significantly. The INS Aridhaman, a new nuclear submarine, will soon join the fleet. This strengthens India's ability to retaliate if attacked. With three such submarines, India can maintain a constant presence at sea. This development enhances national security and strategic deterrence in the region.

title: Connor McDavid and Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: Rondale Moore’s final texts revealed before suspected self‑inflicted death
content: Marquise “Hollywood” Brown says Rondale Moore messaged him just hours before the Minnesota Vikings receiver was found dead in New Albany, Ind., from a suspected self-inflicted gunshot wound. Inside their final texts, Moore’s injury history, and how teammates are using his death to talk honestly about the pressure NFL players carry off the field.

title: Boston Bruins eye Ryan Donato reunion amid post-Olympic shake-up
content: The Boston Bruins are looking ahead to the NHL trade deadline following the Olympic break, considering a roster overhaul in the midst of their playoff run, currently occupying the final Eastern Conference wild card position. A possible trade candidate is former Bruin Ryan Donato, currently playing for the Chicago Blackhawks, who have been struggling this season and may look to move him.

title: Explained: Why US govt keeps shutting down & how India avoids such financial crises
content: America faces recurring government shutdowns. These are not due to a lack of money but a failure to pass spending bills. Recent shutdowns have impacted various agencies, causing furloughs and service disruptions. These funding crises stem from political disagreements, not financial insolvency. India's parliamentary system prevents similar administrative paralysis.

title: Gautam Gambhir in serious chat with out-of-form Abhishek Sharma in team bus – Watch
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir was seen in an intense discussion with struggling opener Abhishek Sharma on the team bus in Chennai. Sharma has had a difficult run in the T20 World Cup 2026, scoring only 15 runs in four matches. This conversation comes ahead of India's crucial Super 8 clash against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Minor incident': HAL dismisses Tejas 'crash' reports; defends jets' safety record
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has clarified that a recent incident reports claiming that a Tejas jet crashed was actually a minor technical issue on the ground. The company emphasized the aircraft's strong safety record and is working with the Indian Air Force for resolution. This statement follows reports of significant damage to a Tejas after overshooting a runway.

title: Quinn Hughes, Jack Hughes back Auston Matthews after USA wins gold
content: The Olympic gold medal victory of Team USA over Canada was the catalyst behind the news when Auston Matthews was defensive whenever asked about his confidence in the NHL. The Toronto Maple Leafs captain was soon vindicated by Quinn Hughes and Jack Hughes, who took the Toronto media to task. The incident was another addition to the legacy of Matthews as he dominated the NHL news after the climactic international final.

title: Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda wedding: Couple to host celebration for close friends
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to marry on February 26 in Udaipur. Wedding festivities have begun with the couple arriving in the city. Family members are expected to join soon. The celebrations are taking place at ITC Mementos Udaipur. A reception is planned for March 4 in Hyderabad.

title: Chasing Kohli, carrying Pakistan: Sahibzada Farhan’s goals in T20 World Cup
content: Having scored 220 runs already, Sahibzada Farhan has emerged as Pakistan’s batting constant in a turbulent T20 World Cup. As questions swirl around strike rates, collapses, and pressure on senior players, Sahibzada Farhan remains unmoved. Even with Virat Kohli’s iconic tournament run record in view. For him, the focus is simple: to score runs and not think about the milestones.

title: How a CSK legend helped South Africa pacer rattle India in T20 WC super 8s
content: Lungi Ngidi credits his IPL stint with Dwayne Bravo for honing his slower deliveries, a key weapon against India.  His subtle variations and clever pace changes, including leg cutters, kept Suryakumar Yadav guessing. Ngidi focused on building pressure rather than just taking wickets, finding his slower ball provides a crucial edge in modern T20 cricket.

title: HC quashes tribunal order directing sons to vacate father’s property: Here's why
content: The judgment was delivered by Justice Somasekhar Sundaresan in Prakash Krishna Gamare & Anr v. Krishna Ganpat Gamre & Anr, where the Court quashed a Maintenance Tribunal order directing two sons to vacate a residential property owned by their father.

title: Ranveer Singh moves to Karnataka HC to quash case over ‘Kantara’ mimicry
content: Actor Ranveer Singh approached the Karnataka High Court to quash a criminal case filed against him for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by imitating a deity from 'Kantara Chapter 1'. His legal team argued it was a sincere tribute, not an insult, and that police notices caused undue stress.

title: 'Abhishek Sharma has passed the baton of 'zeroes' to in-form Ishan Kishan'
content: Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar analyzed India's batting collapse against South Africa, noting Ishan Kishan's early dismissal after Abhishek Sharma's cheap exit. Nayar emphasised the need for better plans against quality off-spin, citing upcoming matches against the West Indies and Roston Chase.

title: After 'slogger' remark, Pakistan's Amir makes fresh Abhishek admission
content: India’s T20 World Cup 2026 campaign suffered a major blow after a 76-run loss to South Africa, complicating their semi-final chances. Opener Abhishek Sharma’s poor form remains a concern, with four straight low scores. Mohammad Amir advised him to be patient and smarter in shot selection, while also criticising India’s chasing weakness and team selection, calling the team combination a key mistake.

title: 'Mental decolonisation': Lutyens' bust replaced by C Rajagopalachari; PM Modi hails move
content: President Droupadi Murmu unveiled a bust of India's first and only Indian Governor General, Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, at Rashtrapati Bhavan, replacing that of British architect Edwin Lutyens. Prime Minister Modi hailed the move as an act of "mental decolonisation," highlighting Rajagopalachari's inspiring public life and contributions.

title: Twist in B'luru gang-rape case: Accused had filed extortion FIR before victim's complaint
content: A 19-year-old psychology student from Tamil Nadu has accused two men, including a friend, of gang-raping her after she was allegedly drugged at a party in north Bengaluru. The incident reportedly occurred around midnight on Saturday at a villa in Jakkur. The student stated she was disoriented and unable to resist the assault.

title: Canada PM Mark Carney to visit India on February 26; trade deal, defence pact in focus
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will embark on a diplomatic tour of India, Australia, and Japan from February 26 to March 7, 2026. In India, he will meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to strengthen bilateral ties, focusing on new partnerships in trade, energy, technology, AI, talent, culture, and defence.

title: T20 World Cup: How South Africa outsmarted a clueless India in Ahmedabad
content: South Africa's tactical approach, mirroring other teams, exploited India's predictable batting order and poor shot selection. India's over-reliance on left-handers and lack of a Plan B proved costly, leading to a significant defeat in the T20 World Cup Super Eight. India now face crucial selection decisions for the game against Zimbabwe to address these vulnerabilities.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Noida's Jewar airport, says UP CM Yogi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate Uttar Pradesh's Noida International Airport at Jewar next month. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath announced this, highlighting the state's leading position in aviation infrastructure with the highest number of airports. The upcoming Jewar airport is poised to become India's largest, serving as a significant hub for both passengers and cargo.

title: What is PRAHAAR? India rolls out first anti-terror doctrine; MHA flags major threats
content: India has launched its first comprehensive anti-terror policy named PRAHAAR. This policy addresses threats from cross-border terrorism, cyber-attacks, and the misuse of drones. It highlights the use of advanced technologies by terror groups for propaganda and funding. PRAHAAR emphasizes coordinated legal, technological, and community-based responses to combat evolving security challenges.

title: Andhra Pradesh, Telangana unite to fund Rs 16 cr jab for baby with rare disorder
content: A collective effort across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana is underway to save 11-month-old Jampala Mangala Punarvika, who needs a Rs 16 crore gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy. The viral '#SavePunarvika' campaign has seen widespread support, including bicycle rallies, schoolchildren's donations, and auto drivers' solidarity, as her parents appeal for help.

title: Why so many women are low on iron, and don’t realise it
content: Across various aspects of modern life, women frequently report feeling exhausted, attributing it to their hectic schedules. Nevertheless, healthcare providers indicate that overlooked low iron levels may be a significant contributor. This silent deficiency disproportionately impacts women, particularly during menstrual cycles and pregnancy.

title: What went wrong for Team India vs South Africa in Super 8s? Proteas legend breaks it down
content: Former South Africa captain Shaun Pollock believes India failed to adapt to Ahmedabad's conditions during their Super 8 defeat to the Proteas. He highlighted India's inability to recognize the "new ball challenge with the seam moving around" and their aggressive approach in the powerplay, which led to early wickets and pressure.

title: Ronyell Whitaker cause of death revealed after ex-NFL DB dies at 46
content: The Minnesota Vikings community is mourning the sudden passing of former defensive back Ronyell Whitaker, who died at 46. Whitaker, who played for the Vikings in 2006 and 2007, was remembered by teammates and coaches for his discipline and work ethic. His family has requested privacy regarding the cause of death.

title: Tamil Nadu SIR final electoral roll: Nearly 97 lakh electors names deleted
content: Tamil Nadu's final electoral roll for 2026 lists 5,67,07,380 electors, with women slightly outnumbering men. Following a special revision, the state saw a significant drop in voters due to 97.37 lakh deletions, primarily in urban areas. However, over 34 lakh new applications for inclusion were subsequently received.

title: 'Overthinking cost India': Rahane blasts team management for dropping Axar
content: India's decision to bench vice-captain Axar Patel for the T20 World Cup Super 8 clash against South Africa has drawn sharp criticism. Former captain Ajinkya Rahane questioned the move, stating that overthinking selection and not backing a proven performer like Patel, despite his vice-captaincy, backfired. Washington Sundar's underwhelming performance further fueled the debate after India's heavy defeat.

title: The great Biryani audit: How eateries cooked the books to hide crores in income
content: A massive tax evasion probe, initiated with biryani sales data, has uncovered a sophisticated digital system allegedly used by prominent Hyderabad restaurant chains to erase cash transactions. Investigators found evidence of widespread sales suppression and manipulation, potentially costing the government thousands of crores. This crackdown signals a shift towards data-driven enforcement in India's booming hospitality sector.

title: 'NEET-PG doesn't certify competence': Centre tells SC
content: The Centre defended its decision to lower NEET-PG qualifying percentiles before the Supreme Court, stating the exam generates a merit list for limited seats, not certify minimum competence. The government argued that licensed MBBS doctors are already qualified and supervised during postgraduate studies, addressing concerns about patient safety due to vacant seats.

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Razorbacks beat the Musketeers 7-6 in a road series against Tennessee . the Vols dropped seven spots to no. 20 in this week's rankings . they're facing the top team in the country in UCLA on Friday .

title: Ex-Colonel Said He's A Veteran. "Hum Zamindar Ke Bete," Replied Attackers
content: A retired Indian Army officer who was assaulted by a group of men, beer bottles in hand, in Haryana's Gurugram has shared more details of the attack that left him injured, following a minor traffic incident. He spent two days in a hospital.

title: Vijay's Chennai North Debut Puts DMK Bastion To Test
content: Actor-turned-politician Vijay's decision to enter the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections from Chennai North signals one of the most consequential political shifts the state has seen in years.

title: Man, 30, Dies By Suicide. He Thought He Would Contract Rabies After Dog Bite
content: A 30-year-old bank employee in Maharashtra's Kalyan died by suicide on Sunday, reportedly due to an overwhelming fear of contracting rabies after a stray dog bite.

title: Tamil Nadu Final Electoral Roll Published, Voter Strength At 5.43 Crore
content: Tamil Nadu's final electoral roll has been officially published on Monday following an extensive Special Intensive Revision (SIR) undertaken in compliance with directions from the Election Commission of India and the Supreme Court.

title: "How Low Can Congress Get": BJP Slams "Missing" Post On Piyush Goyal
content: The temporary absence of Union Minister Piyush Goyal from public view has sparked another Congress versus BJP, with the Opposition party tagging him as "missing".

title: Yogi Adityanath Secures Rs 6,650-Crore Investment Pacts In Singapore
content: On the first day of his visit to Singapore, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday secured three memoranda of understanding (MoUs) worth Rs 6,650 crore with Universal Success Group.

title: Om Birla Constitutes Parliamentary Friendship Groups With 64 Nations
content: Amid strained ties with the opposition parties, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday constituted Parliamentary Friendship Groups with more than 60 countries.

title: Government Land Worth Rs 77 Crore Registered As Waqf In Madhya Pradesh: CAG
content: A major controversy has erupted in Madhya Pradesh after the Comptroller and Auditor General of India exposed serious irregularities in the registration of waqf properties across the state.

title: Mukul Roy's Death Turns Political Flashpoint Between Trinamool, BJP
content: Political accusations and counter-allegations dominated reactions to the death of veteran Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Mukul Roy, even as tributes poured in from across party lines.

title: Hours After Wedding, Odisha Bride Fakes Own Kidnapping With Lover's Help
content: In a startling turn of events in Odisha's Subarnapur district, a newly married woman allegedly plotted her own "kidnapping" with the help of her lover, police said.

title: PM Modi Congratulates Manipuri Film "Boong" For Its BAFTA Win
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi used social media to congratulate the Manipuri film "Boong" for winning the prestigious 'Best Children's & Family Film' title at the 79th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA).

title: Congress To Hold Farmers' Rally In Bhopal Against India-US Trade Deal
content: A major political showdown is set to unfold in Bhopal on February 24 as the Congress party organises a massive farmers' mahachaupal against the proposed India-US trade deal.

title: New York Orders Travel Ban, Schools Shut Down As Major Storm Hits US
content: New York ordered drivers off the road and shut down schools on Monday, while residents hunkered down for a massive snowstorm hitting the United States northeast.

title: US Accuses China Of "Massively Expanding" Nuclear Arsenal
content: Washington on Monday accused China of dramatically swelling its nuclear arsenal, and doubled down on claims that Beijing has conducting secret nuclear tests, demanding again it be part of any future arms control treaty.

title: Opinion: Opinion | In Bangladesh, A Story Of Many Wins
content: The rain is over, and the clouds are clearing. Now, the hard work of rebuilding a nation begins, and India must be standing right there alongside as a friend.

title: Rain Or Snow, Inside India's 326-Day Mountain Op To Hunt 7 Pak Terrorists
content: Operation Trashi-1, the long, sustained hunt for Pakistan-trained terrorists by the Indian Army, police tactical units, and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in the forests and mountains of Jammu and Kashmir, is a shining example of courage.

title: Minor, Lover Die By Suicide After Objections Over Inter-Caste Relationship
content: A minor and her lover, said to be in his early 20s, allegedly died by suicide after facing opposition over their inter-caste relationship in Jharkhand's Gumla district, officials said.

title: 'While You Eat Dung, We Eat Beef": Kerala Minister Jeers Amid Film Controversy
content: The sequel of the controversial movie "The Kerala Story" is also making headlines for a scene that portrays a Hindu girl being forced to eat beef.

title: Pentagon Chief Summons Anthropic CEO Over Military Use Of Claude AI: Report
content: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth has summoned artificial intelligence company Anthropic's CEO Dario Amodei to the Pentagon on Tuesday.

title: How El Mencho, El Chapo's Sons Forged A Drug Empire That Shook 2 Continents
content: The helicopters came low over the tree line at first light, rotors beating the humid air above the mountains of southern Jalisco, a region long whispered about in Mexican intelligence briefings as the nerve centre of a deadly cartel.

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: ESPN's Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at second base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the most coveted free agent in the fall will be Tarik Skubal .

title: Way-too-early preview for the 2030 Olympics
content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: 2028 USA Olympic men's roster: Expect a youth movement
content: team USA has consistently medaled in five-on-five men's basketball . the americans haven't won the medal count at a Winter Games since 1932 . they have topped the medal table in seven of the past eight summer games .

title: A gold medal 46 years in the making: Inside Team USA's epic win over Canada
content: Connor Hellebuyck and canada's Jordan Binnington win the men's hockey gold medal . he is the reigning NHL MVP and winner of the Vezina Trophy as the league's best goaltender . the game went into overtime on tuesday .

title: Olympic standouts, disappointments from all 32 NHL teams
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament ended in thrilling fashion . both teams were comprised of players -- many of them superstars . all but one of the countries had at least one active NHL player on the roster . it's time to assess which players will be coming home content with how they performed .

title: Union: WNBA made enough for revenue sharing
content: the WNBA generated enough revenue in 2025 to trigger revenue sharing . union leaders said the league notified player leadership earlier this month that they hit the benchmark . the 13 teams will receive a total of $8 million from the league to disperse among players .

title: 🎖️ Shots of gold: Winter Olympics, in pictures
content: the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have come to a close, bringing thrilling action and memorable moments in spades . we compiled collages that take a look at the story of each of the Games' days overall, as well as one specific snapshot of particular significance .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: 7 killed, 21 injured as sleeper bus overturns on Lucknow expressway
content: When not covering crime, he reads fiction, roams around the dark alleys of the city in the dead of night. An MA (English Litt) from University of Lucknow, Pathikrit loves to speak French, well at least a smattering of it. He did his graduation in French language. A recipient of the Road Safety Fellowship of the United Nations, Pathikrit drives cautiously and advises others to do that too. Read More

title: Indo-U.S. trade deal, your name figuring in Epstein files are shameful, not the peaceful protests, Rahul Gandhi tells Modi
content: The Congress condemns the arrest of Youth Congress leaders, alleges that family members of Youth Congress workers are harassed. PM Modi had called Youth Congress leaders’ ‘shirtless’ protest at the Delhi AI summit ‘naked politics’ and said that it was shameful.

title: Waiting for an opportunity to serve you, Modi tells people of West Bengal
content: In an open letter, the PM says entire nation is worried about the State as it sinks into the “darkness of anarchy” and urges people to take an oath to build a ‘Viksit West Bengal’ in 2026

title: Labour Ministry changes norms for scholarship to children of unorganised workers
content: In another reform measure, the Ministry decided to settle 7.11 lakh inoperative accounts of the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO)

title: IDFC First Bank fraud case flagged in Haryana Assembly
content: The alertness of State government departments had shed light on the issue, following which the government had immediately de-empanelled IDFC First Bank, Chief Minister says

title: Hospitals cannot treat doctors like workmen in a factory: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says one hospital cannot treat another hospital as a rival and include non-compete and non-solicit clauses in agreements with doctors

title: Tamil Nadu electorate stands at 5.67 crore after Special Intensive Revision
content: The Sholinganallur Assembly constituency in Chengalpattu  district continues to have the highest number of electors, with 5,36,991, and the Harbour constituency in Chennai district has the lowest number of voters, with 1,16,896

title: UNICEF experts stress rights-based approach to tackling non-communicable diseases among children
content: NCDs are not often talked about in context of children and young population, says Raoul Bermejo, health specialist and lead on non-communicable diseases, UNICEF headquarters, New York

title: 250 judicial officers drafted for final SIR push in Bengal; leaves cancelled, important cases shifted to other courts
content: As lakhs of voters wait for clearance, the February 28 schedule of final voter list publication remains uncertain

title: It is for RGUHS and experts to decide on providing key or model answers to subjective questions in MBBS course exams: Karnataka High Court
content: It is not open to this Court to evolve a method for evaluating answer scripts and to supplant the method provided under the ordinance, it said

title: Parliamentary panel questions timing of PM Modi’s Israel visit amid regional tensions
content: Foreign Secretary says security considerations guide all high‑level travel; MPs flag cuts in MEA budget and Chabahar allocation

title: Budget session of legislature to start from March 16
content: Budget to be presented on March 20, State Cabinet finalises dates for Budget session after marathon discussion

title: Watch: Double-Decker bus carrying 80+ passengers crashes in UP, five Killed
content: According to officials, 80-85 passengers were onboard the bus, which was going from Ludhiana in Punjab to Motihari in Bihar, when the accident took place

title: Senior academicians call IYC protest at AI summit ‘profoundly regrettable and ill-conceived’
content: Among the signatories of the joint statement are JNU Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit, IIT Roorkee Director Kamal Kishore Pant, and IIT Dharwad Director Venkappayya R Desai; they said converting the event into an ‘occasion for political demonstration’ reflected a serious lack of judgment

title: Watch: DMK alliance talks heat up as allies demand more seats
content: The party has begun crucial seat-sharing talks with its allies, as it works to finalise who will contest how many seats in the 243-member Assembly

title: Trial begins in Pothundy twin murder case
content: Accused Chenthamara to be transfered from high-security Thrissur prison to District Jail at Malampuzha for the duration of the trial

title: How romance scam can steal your hearts and money, spot the red flags, and stay safe online*
content: The TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity. title: 'Let me tell you what shame is': Rahul counters PM, flags US trade deal & Epstein files
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Karnataka contributes one-fifth to the national bioeconomy: Report
content: Karnataka saw 218 new biotech start-ups being added in 2025 alone, marking the highest annual biotech start-up additions in three years.

title: Development is not about statistics alone, but uplifting those left behind, says CM
content: He says completion of five lakh LIFE Mission houses and township for families hit by the Wayanad landslides the fulfilment of social interventions made to ensure sustenance of the people and their livelihood

title: A.P. Assembly to discuss Tirumala adulterated ghee issue on February 24
content: The government is planning a legislation to empowers TTD authorities to initiate criminal action against those who violate temple regulations

title: We don’t share user data, WhatsApp tells Supreme Court
content: Will fully comply with National Company Law Appellate Tribunal directions on user consent for sharing data with Meta, says WhatsApp as both challenge imposition of penalty of ₹213.14 crore

title: 45-year-old doctor loses ₹22.25 lakh in matrimonial app fraud
content: The complainant alleged that the accused later claimed his international bank account had become non-functional and sought her assistance in transferring funds to his ‘agents’ in India

title: SGOU unveils Graduate Employability Framework
content: Eyes placement target of over 70% in five years, skill-integrated curriculum to strengthen industry linkages

title: Four loading workers killed as sunshade of godown collapses on them  in Kozhikode
content: Four others seriously injured in the accident. Incident at Valiyangadi when the four were taking rest near the old building.  They were taking rest under the 50-metre long sunshade after unloading goods to a nearby shop around 12 noon

title: Bill scrapping two-child norm for ryots’ organisations passed in A.P. Assembly
content: Having felt that the sub-optimal rate would adversely affect the State’s demographic dividend, the government decided to do away with the norm, says Minister

title: GI assets can become engines of rural prosperity: Mysuru MP
content: Mr. Wadiyar says export push for Nanjangud Rasabale and Mysore Betel Leaf has gained momentum as Mysuru’s famous GI products get national recognition in ‘Mann Ki Baat’

title: Southern Railway withholds staff allowances citing financial constraints
content: Maintenance of assets and other running costs resulted in expenditure exceeding budget, say officials; they express hope that Railway Board would release a special grant, enabling disbursal of allowances for February and March along with April salary

title: A.P. government committed to social equity and welfare, says Naidu
content: The government is pursuing social empowerment by ensuring proportional representation for weaker sections in accordance with population, says CM

title: Seafood poisoning at Vizhinjam restaurant: doctors suspect neurotoxin
content: It is suspected that the seafood, which triggered serious symptoms, was contaminated by a naturally occurring and extremely potent marine neurotoxin, possibly, tetrodotoxin. They pinpoint fish roe to be the possible culprit

title: 14th century Konda Bitragunta temple renovated, all set for Brahmotsavams
content: Repair and renovation works were taken up by the State Endowments Department recently, with several donors chipping in with their contributions

title: Minister orders probe into anuria deaths in Rajamahendravaram
content: Samples of milk, cattle feed, water, and fodder have been sent to a lab, and the reports are expected in 72 hours, says Minister

title: Certain proposals in the Draft National Electricity Policy, 2026, likely to adversely impact Kerala: Electricity Minister K. Krishnankutty
content: Minister expresses concern over proposals promoting competition in electricity supply and reducing cross-subsidies

title: Sale of meat near educational institutions causes ‘violent tendencies’ in children: Bihar Deputy CM
content: Vijay Kumar Sinha says the Bihar government banned the sale of meat and fish in the open and near educational and religious institutions in urban areas in view of public health and sentiment

title: Police targeting Hindutva activists in keeping with govt.’s appeasement policy, says Yatnal
content: The law and order situation has deteriorated completely, as govt. policy has emboldened communal elements, according to Vijayapura MLA

title: Young minds introduced to frontier tech innovations
content: Navakanta Bhat, dean, Division of Interdisciplinary Sciences, and professor at CeNSE, IISc, and Y. Dilip, director, ADE, DRDO, Bengaluru, share deep perspectives and experiences at ‘illuminate’ in Mysuru

title: Govt. mulling mega job calendar, including teacher posts, by Ugadi, says Lokesh
content: Work under way regarding vertical and horizontal reservation for KGBV teachers, the HRD Minister announces in the Assembly

title: Nellore sees surge in demand for rooftop solar electricity scheme
content: As many as 32,000 SC/ST households, which are eligible for 100 per cent subsidy, have given consent letters for the installation of solar panels on their roofs

title: Bapatla beaches set for development as sustainable tourist destination
content: A team led by Bapatla Collector visits Goa toexamine best practices in tourism regulation, safety, environmental management, and stakeholder engagement
